arts.ttl: The lowdown on Middlesbrough 1 Millwall 0 - Lack of end product in final third will be a big job for Neil Harris’ successor
arts.sum: Something the Lions have been good at under Harris is making sure they stay in games, only Watford and Bristol City have scored more than one goal against Millwall this season and they were the first two opponents of the campaign. As stated above, the South Londoners were not short of chances, Langstaff and Azeez both had big opportunities either side of Boro’s opening goal.

arts.ttl: ‘This second spell has been special’ - Millwall head coach Neil Harris bows out after defeat at Middlesbrough
arts.sum: Neil Harris was disappointed to end his Millwall reign with a defeat but was keen to reflect on how far the football club has come over the last 10 months. “As much as I’m a winner and hate losing, it’s always been about the same thing at this football club – penalty areas.

arts.ttl: Why hard-fought Millwall win was one of Michael Carrick's 'favourites' as Middlesbrough boss
arts.sum: Michael Carrick labelled Middlesbrough’s 1-0 win over Millwall as one of his favourites as Boro boss because of the way his side had to grind out a result. They’re an extremely tough team to play against, so to win was great.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough not at their best but do enough to return to the top six in Millwall win
arts.sum: Ensuring Neil Harris didn’t get his wish to end his Millwall spell with a win, Emmanuel Latte Lath scored an early goal that proved enough for Boro in a game that won’t go down as a classic. By no means Boro at their best, they started the second half with a little more intent, but it quickly returned to the scrappy nature of the first half.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough spoil Neil Harris’s Millwall farewell
arts.sum: Emmanuel Latte Lath scored the only goal after 10 minutes.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough 'authority' demand with Neil Harris Riverside factor
arts.sum: You never take anything for granted, but it’s certainly a good feeling when you know you’re capable of doing it and know you can score goals to win games. We want to win games and so it’s vital we put in a good performance.

arts.ttl: Saturday's Championship predictions including Middlesbrough vs. Millwall
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's Championship fixtures, including Middlesbrough vs. Millwall.

arts.ttl: Michael Carrick backing Middlesbrough loanee Josh Coburn despite latest Millwall setback
arts.sum: The young Boro striker is currently on the sidelines with a broken metatarsal, which is the second injury he’s suffered already this season. Sending him on loan in the summer to try and get his body used to playing regular Championship football after injury struggles last term, Coburn has so far been frustrated in those attempts.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough's unique Championship advantage is also potential selection headache - Eric Paylor
arts.sum: In Neil Warnock’s Covid-hit season in charge, Akpom played more league games than any other forward at the club but managed a mere four goals. It’s a long time since Boro had two really productive strikers in the side at the same time, though Akpom and Cameron Archer scored 40 goals between them in Carrick’s first season on Teesside.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough's next ten games are a great opportunity providing they do one thing
arts.sum: Speaking before Burnley, Conway reflected on Boro's form, saying: “People are going to start seeing us as a good team now and we’ve got to try to live up to that expectation. Boro have slipped out of the top six heading into Saturday's clash with Millwall having come through two of the toughest games the fixture schedule will throw up this season consecutively with just one point.
